quiz_info.instruction: Answer the following questions about the story A Blue Whale Tale.

questions.question: What is the meaning of blubber?
Who are whalers?
The blue whale is a big marine _________ .
What does the word banned mean?
How many blue whales are around the world now?
What does the word recovery mean?
Where were three whales spotted in 2004?
What does the word extinction mean?
What is the story about?
Why are whales traveling north?

quiz_info.instruction: Answer the following questions. Select the correct answer.

questions.question: The reading selection is a _________.
The mouse was _________.
The lion learned a ________.
The hunters wanted to ____________ the lion.
The mouse was a ___________.
The lion decided to _________.
A fable is a _________.
What happened at the beginning of the story?

answersFake.text: The lion let go of the mouse.

questions.question: What happened in the middle of the story?

answersFake.text: The mouse chewed up the ropes.
He put his huge paw on the mouse.

answersTrue.text: The lion lifted its paw and let the mouse go.

questions.question: What happened at the end of the story?

answersFake.text: The mouse ran up the lion’s belly.
The lion was trapped by the hunter.

answersTrue.text: The mouse chewed away the ropes that bounded the lion.

quiz_info.instruction: Read the following events and select the correct answer to each question.

questions.question:
Which of the following events happened first?

Jose got up from the floor.

Everyone looked at him and no one helped him.

Jose tripped on the rock and fell down.

answersFake.text: Jose got up from the floor.
Everyone looked at him and no one helped him.

answersTrue.text: Jose tripped on the rock and fell down.

questions.question:
Which of the following events happened last?

Carlos went to buy the ingredients for his lasagna.

Carlos prepared a meat lasagna for dinner.

Carlos ate his dinner.

answersFake.text: Carlos prepared a meat lasagna for dinner.
Carlos went to buy the ingredients for his lasagna.

questions.question:
Which event does not follow the sequence?

The truck had a flat tire.

Manuel bought popcorn and soda for the two of them.

Sara and Manuel went to the movies.

answersFake.text: Sara and Manuel went to the movies.
Manuel bought popcorn and soda for the two of them.

answersTrue.text: The truck had a flat tire.

questions.question:
Which of the following events happened first?

Julmarie cut the meat and prepared the ingredients.

Julmarie made a pastrami sandwich.

Julmarie ate the sandwich.

answersTrue.text: Julmarie cut the meat and prepared the ingredients.

questions.question:
Which of the following events happened first?

Yahaira got in her car.

Yahaira took out her car keys.

Yahaira started the car.

answersFake.text: Yahaira took out her car keys.

questions.question:
Which of the following events happened first?

Peter ate the ice cream.

Peter bought an ice cream.

Peter went to the ice cream shop.

answersTrue.text: Peter went to the ice cream shop.

questions.question:
Which of the following events happened last?

Peter bought an ice cream.

Peter went the ice cream shop.

Peter ate the ice cream.

answersFake.text: Peter went the ice cream shop.

questions.question:
Which of the following events happened first?

Anthony won the game.

Anthony played on the playstation for hours.

Anthony turned on the TV.

answersFake.text: Anthony played on the playstation for hours.

questions.question:
Which of the following events happened last?

Anthony won the game.

Anthony played on the playstation for hours.

Anthony turned on the TV.

answersFake.text: Anthony played on the playstation for hours.

questions.question:
Place the events in order and select the correct sequence?

1. Take the bag of popcorn out of the microwave.


2. Press the button that indicates popcorn.


3. Wait until the microwave beeps.


4. Put the popcorn bag in the microwave.

quiz_info.instruction: Read the following short story and select the best answer.

questions.question: Cristina wanted to have a __________.
Cristina was ______ years old.
Mrs. Lopez was Cristina’s __________.
Cristina called _________.
Verdy was Cristina’s pet_______.

Read the situation and predict what will happen:

Cristina finally has her pet snake.

answersFake.text: Christina will let Mrs. Lopez to take care of the snake.
Cristina will let the snake unattended.

answersTrue.text: Cristina will take responsibility for her new pet.

questions.question:
Read the situation and predict what will happen:

Verdy’s glass tank is dirty.

answersFake.text: The snake will clean it up herself.

answersTrue.text: Cristina will clean the glass tank.

questions.question:
Read the situation and predict what will happen:

Cristina heard a noise from the neighbor's house again.

answersFake.text: She will call the fire department.

answersTrue.text: She will check out what is going on.

questions.question:
Read the situation and predict what will happen:

Her snake does not fit in the tank.

answersFake.text: She will put it in a box.
She will put it in a cage.

answersTrue.text: She will buy a bigger tank.

questions.question:
Read the situation and predict what will happen:

Verdy begins to lose its skin.

answersFake.text: She will clean up the skin.
She will put some medication on him.

answersTrue.text: She will take him to the vet.

quiz_info.instruction: Read the sentences below and identify which are fiction or non-fiction.

questions.question: The lion roared when he was hungry.
The mouse helped the elephant escape from the zoo.
The little kitten grew into a giant cat that took over the city.
The president declared a state of emergency.
Dinosaurs were on this planet millions of years ago.
The three little pigs wanted to make houses to live in.
Harry Potter ruled the kingdom with his magical powers.
The superheroes discovered the villain's hideout.
The bananas on the island were eaten by the monkeys.
The astronaut had enough space on the moon to build his own house.

quiz_info.instruction: Read the following sentences and identify which are fact or opinion.

questions.question: The girls in my classroom are beautiful.
Barack Obama is the first afro-american president of the United States.
Rainy days are fabulous.
The Discovery of Puerto Rico was on November 19, 1493.
Mrs. Rivera is a very good teacher.
Frogs and snakes are interesting animals.
Bayamon is very far away from Ponce.
Valentine’s Day is on February 14.
English is everybody’s favorite class.
Marcos was born in Bayamon.

quiz_info.instruction: Read the following fable and answer the questions. Select the correct answer.

questions.question: Who is the main character?
What was the fox planning to do?

answersFake.text: to be part of the sheep

questions.question: What strategy did he use?
What happened at the end of the story?
What is the moral lesson of the fable?

answersFake.text: Seek to do good and harm will come to you.
Seek to do harm and good will come to you.

answersTrue.text: Seek to do harm and harm will come to you.

quiz_info.instruction: Select the correct synonym or antonym for the underlined word in each sentence.

questions.question: The synonym of difficult is ___________.

quiz_info.instruction: Read and identify the parts of the letter and other information.

questions.question: Dear John: is an example of a ___________.
May 3, 2013 is an example of a ___________.

I am very happy visiting my Uncle David. I will be here for two weeks. Next Tuesday we are going fishing and Uncle David said I could use his fishing pole. I can’t wait! I will see soon!
This is an example of a:
The date is at the _________ of the letter.
The signature is at the _____________ of the letter.
The body is at located in the __________ of the letter.
What is the letter used for?
The ____________ is at the beginning of the letter.
An example of the closing is ___________.
The signature tells us ___________.

answersTrue.text: the name of the author of the letter

quiz_info.instruction: Look at the following picture and determine if the sentences are describing details in the picture.

questions.question: The white refrigerator has many things on top.
The scary orange pumpkin is on the window sill.
The birds are flying over the mountains.
The green paint spilled down the kitchen cabinet.
The black cat clock is on the blue wall.
The red and white box is on top of the refrigerator.
The children's drawings are on the refrigerator door.
This living room is very clean and neat.
The toy soldiers are on the counter.
There is a yellow sun on the refrigerator.

quiz_info.instruction: Identify if the following sentence are details inferred or that can be observed.

questions.question: There’s a sailboat on the lake.
The buildings are red and orange.
The girl plays tennis better than the boy.
There are people riding bicycles.
There’s a boy on the slide with an ice cream cone in his hand.
The little dog seems friendly but can be aggressive.
The bench in the middle is red.
The baby does not like the baby carriage.
The girl and boy on the seesaw are family .
The runners are tired.

quiz_info.instruction: Select the correct answer.

questions.question: Which text feature helps explain an illustration?
Which text feature identifies the name of the story?
Which text feature informs where the information can be found?
Which text feature helps to find an unknown word?
What text feature can contribute to the understanding of the story?
Which text feature is used to help locate an area or place?
Which text feature is used to organize data?
Which of the following text features shows important words?
Which text feature is an alphabetical list of ideas that are in the book?
What is the purpose of text features?

answersFake.text: To make the text more attractive.
